alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 8:32PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Warning for the Slate River and its Tributaries... ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive runoff from prior very heavy rainfall during the last three days. * WHERE...Buckingham county in central Virginia. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring as a result of excessive rainfall during the past several days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM EDT, The Slate River at Arvonia VA remains in minor flood at 800 PM EDT this evening. The river is currently cresting around 12.5 feet and should begin to fall over the next several hours. However, it will remain in flood for at least the next 2-3 hours. This flooding is the result of runoff from prior heavy rainfall and completely saturated soils during the past several days. - In addition to the Slate River, this includes the following streams and drainages... Sharps Creek, Muddy Creek, Rocky Creek, James River, and Crooked Creek. - This will impact mainly rural areas of Northern Buckingham County. - Additional information on flooding, river, and lake levels can be found on our web site located at, http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from flooded rivers, creeks, and streams or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
